Patch Set 22: Commit message was updated.
Add full description by following commit message guidelines.
Done.

Mark it as WIP and pull it for review when its ready.

Current not reviewing code. Let me know once ready.
Done.
can you use d-bus calls to get the i2c bus number and i2c slave address of the PFR mail box. Please refer PFR Manager code on how this is done.
Done.
I don't see updated code but comment is moved to resolve. Don't resolve the comments unless its done.
can you make it const?

Cannot make it const as we are modifying 'valHigh'  in 
valHigh = mailBoxReply | valHigh
line 211
Addressed the review comments.
why is this moved here?

This is done so that we can access the same variables in pfr-manager.cpp file.
Please see pfr-manager.cpp line no 197 and 198.
Can we use constexpr here? I think declaring static variable in header file not encouraged
unrelated change?
Not sure about this change. I needed to make this change. Otherwise build was getting failed.
move these definitions to hpp file, name the register as blackout register or something.
Done.

Move definition of mailBoxReply to inside this scope. Its not used outside this.
https://isocpp.github.io/CppCoreGuidelines/CppCoreGuidelines#es5-keep-scopes-small
Definitions moved to header file.
better to use use another variable to store the result of | operation and declare valHigh mailBoxReg  etc as constexpr
Another variable used. And Definitions moved to header file.

Any security validation required on the register address here? 
Are we introducing a DBUs method to call any read any register value?
I dont think any security validation is required here. No DBUs method call is here.
Is https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pfr-manager/+/56078 this need to be merged here?
No this does not need to be merged. Create by mistake. Will close it.
These can be constexpr? I didnt see these variables modified anywhere

Getting following compile error on making this as consexpr:
error: non-static data member 'blackOutReg' declared 'constexpr'
I think i2cBusNumber and i2cSlaveAddr will have internal linkage . changes made to these from pfr.cpp wont be seen here right?
I am not sure about this. But I think changes made from pfr.cpp should reflect here as same variables are used here.
Make it in single line.
Done.
Nitpick: I don't think we need this prefix in commit titles
Done.
And add the following text: "This patch introduces capability to intimate PFR about BMC busy period"
Done.
Please capture this as "placeholder code is implemented for write operations"
Done.
For inclusive naming, please use "bmcBusyReg"
Done.

Please capture a comment saying 
/* Placeholder code */
Done.
Only the Line 212 is a placeholder code, right?
Corrected.

Moving Static variables to hpp file would result in having copies of these variables in every translation unit it is being included.
Is this desirable ?

This will result in not reflecting the value loaded into them by the dbus call in pfr.cpp
I found this is the only way to use the same variables in pfr.cpp and pfr_mgr.cpp. If we remove the static then we are getting the compilation error.

We could also use "extern" keyword if we really need the variable to be used in another translation unit.

By keeping it in the header file like in the present code, each translation unit is going to have a separate copy of the variable.
Which means, if any file is trying to load the bus and address to these variables from a dBus call, then this value will not reflect in the other files.

Either we need to extern them or, call the dbus call where ever required.
I tried yo use extern but got build on using extern. So used the dbus call by taking reference from pfr.cpp.

Do these variables need to be part of this class ?
I see these are more like runtime variables then class members

This is done as a result of one review comment. There was a review comment
to move these variables to here.

Could you please point me to that comment ?
Having these variables as part of the class doesn't seem good.
As cakked out earlier, these variables are more of runtime consumption and do not have any significance to be part of this class.

Or, am i missing something here ?

Below is the link for earlier review comment which mentioned to move the definitions to header file.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/pfr-manager/+/52364/8..20/service/src/pfr_mgr.cpp#b203

Anyways I have removed these definitions from header file and kept it local.
Do we need these local variables? I think these variables can be omitted.
This is just done for simplicity. Otherwise we need to write pfr::i2cBusNumber and pfr::i2cSlaveAddress everywhere.

I think it is better to call out "pfr::i2cBusNumber" and "pfr::i2cSlaveAddress" as it makes it more readable.
Declaring a variable for this purpose doesn't look good. We can may be use "using" if really required.
Corrected.
Since we are passing "this", do we need to capture Bus Number and Slave Address ? I think we should be able to directly access them right?
I checked we need to pass mailBoxBusNumber, mailBoxSlaveAddr in capture clause as these are not class member variables. If we do not pass them we get compilation error.
*Nit: Did you mean "Exception caught while setting PFR Mailbox to BMCBusy"
Corrected.
